page.title: 02Devon Tors _ Ref 0276 0084
page.content: Geologically and Geographically this area is one with Dartmoor itself. The rocks are precisely similar in character. The summit of Hingston Down is crowned with granite masses known as Hingston Rocks and has an elevation of 1000ft.The footpath to this rock is overgrown and difficult to follow. Rather more than one mile to the East rises Blackingstone Rock which is considerably over 1000ft and is the finest example of a dome_shaped tor.This rock lies near the road and is easily accessible.It can quite easily be climbed with the help of steps cut into the rock,and handrails. The view from the top makes the climb well worth_while.
